com.myronmarston.music
Enum NoteName

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<NoteName>
      com.myronmarston.music.NoteName
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<NoteName>
public enum NoteName
extends java.lang.Enum<NoteName>

Enumerates all the valid note names. These are used to parse a note string and to provide key signatures. Each of the 7 letter names (A-G) has 5 variations: double flat (bb), flat (b), natural (just the letter name), sharp (s, since java does not allow # in enum names) and double sharp (x).

getNoteNumber

public int getNoteNumber()
Gets the number of half steps this note name is above C.

Returns:
the number of half steps this note name is above C

getLetterNumber

public int getLetterNumber()
Gets the size of the interval of this note name's musical letter compared to C. The interval is 0-based, rather than 1-based, as intervals are in music theory (i.e. C to E is considered to be a 2nd, rather than a 3rd).

Returns:
the letter number

getMajorKeySharpsOrFlats

public int getMajorKeySharpsOrFlats()
Gets the number of sharps or flats for this major key. Positive indicates sharps; negative indicates flats.

Returns:
the number of sharps or flats for the major key

getMinorKeySharpsOrFlats

public int getMinorKeySharpsOrFlats()
Gets the number of sharps or flats for this minor key. Positive indicates sharps; negative indicates flats.

Returns:
the number of sharps or flats for the minor key

getPositiveIntervalSize

public int getPositiveIntervalSize(NoteName other)
Gets the positive interval size of the given note name compared to this note name. Note that this is 0-based, rather than 1-based, as intervals are in music theory (i.e. C to E is considered to be a 2nd, rather than a 3rd).

Parameters:
other - the note name to compare to this one to get the interval size
Returns:
the size of the interval

getPositiveChromaticSteps

public int getPositiveChromaticSteps(NoteName other)
Gets the number of positive chromatic steps between two notes.

Parameters:
other - the note name to compare to
Returns:
the number of positive chromatic steps

getDefaultNoteNameForNumber

public static NoteName getDefaultNoteNameForNumber(int noteNumber)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Gets the default note name for the given number. For example, "5" would yield "F" rather than "E_SHARP".

Parameters:
noteNumber - the number of half steps above C
Returns:
the NoteName
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number is < 0 or > 11

getNoteName

public static NoteName getNoteName(java.lang.String str)
Gets the NoteName that corresponds to the given string.

Parameters:
str - note name string, such as 'C#' or 'Eb'
Returns:
the NoteName, or null if the string does not match any NoteName

getRegexPattern

public static java.lang.String getRegexPattern()
Gets a regular expression pattern for parsing the NoteName from a Note string.

Returns:
the regular expression pattern string
